main event: A bright object resembling an exhaust flame was observed for approximately 30 seconds on January 21, 1950.
interesting points: The object was visible for 30 seconds and emitted no noise or trail., The observation was thought to be a normal phenomenon., Photographs were taken during the observation but were not successful., The sighting occurred at coordinates 22-23N 179-49E., The object appeared to be cylindrical in shape, about 60-80 ft long and 15-20 ft wide.
sighted object: a bright object similar to an exhaust flame
witness description: pilot and copilot of a flight
